trial_identification.studytitle: CORRELATION BETWEEN THE LUMBAR LORDOSIS ANGLE AND THE DEGREE OF GYNOID LYPODYSTROPHY (CELLULITE) IN ASYMPTOMATIC WOMEN.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Correlation between the degree of cellulite and lumbar lordosis measured by Cobbs method in 50 asymptomatic women

interventions.interventions: The volunteers were evaluated by using photograph, palpation and thermograph Therefore the cellulite grading was classified in 1,2,3 and 4. ). The volunteers performed the x-ray in lateral view and the angle of lumbar lordosis was measured by using Cobbs method (inferior endplate of T12 and superior endplate of S1). All the procedures were done at the same day. It takes one year to finish the 50 voluntaries.

primaryOutcome.outcome: lumbar lordosis and correlation with cellullite
primaryOutcome.timepoint: at 1 year when all volunteers have undergone the procedures

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Sex (women), age (20 to 35 years) and that with no exclusion criteria
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: neurological, respiratory, circulatory or rheumatic disease, sedentary, women with current or previous pregnancy, obesity or with index of corporal mass (IMC) bigger or equal the 24,9 kg/m2, description of previous surgeries of the vertebral column, lumbar back pain or other disease of lumbar region.

othercollaborator.othercollaboratorname: Hospital Universitario da Universidade de Sao Paulo (USP)

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Gynoid Lypodystrophy (cellulite) is a common dermatological alteration. Its presence and severity have been related to many factors as biotype, age, sex, circulatory alteration and some authors have suggested also a relation with some mechanical alterations like the hyperlordosis. The objective of this study was to correlate the cellulite grading with the angle of lumbar lordosis in asymptomatic women.
